title: Josep Maria Gonzalvo
text:
Josep Maria Gonzalvo Solà (born 3 February 1959) is a Spanish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">manager</a>.
Football career.
Born in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, Gonzalvo began his career with Almenar CF. After being subsequently in charge of <a href="CF%20Balaguer">CF Balaguer</a>, CF Calafell, <a href="UA%20Horta">UA Horta</a> and <a href="FC%20Santboi%C3%A0">FC Santboià</a>, he joined <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> in 1996, being initially appointed manager of <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20C">the C-team</a> in <a href="Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Tercera División</a>.
Gonzalvo <a href="1996%E2%80%9397%20Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">achieved promotion</a> with the C-side, but the relegation of <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20B">the reserves</a> impeded their promotion to <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">Segunda División B</a>. In 1997, he was named manager of the latter team, also in the third division.
Gonzalvo achieved promotion to the second division in <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">his first season</a>, but <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">suffered immediate relegation</a>. On 29 October 2002, he was appointed manager of <a href="CF%20Reus%20Deportiu">CF Reus Deportiu</a> in the third division, <a href="2002%E2%80%9303%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">suffering team relegation</a> but achieving <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">immediate promotion</a>.
On 22 June 2004, Gonzalvo was appointed in charge of third division side <a href="UE%20Figueres">UE Figueres</a>. On 19 October of the following year, he was named at the helm of <a href="CE%20Matar%C3%B3">CE Mataró</a> in the fourth division.
